result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Lee Newman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250.00 cash bond applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.   Must have no contact with George or Donna E. or Shelby A..
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants Huber for work, work search and treatment as Sheriff will allow. May be served in Eau Claire or Chippewa County Jail if at no cost to Barron County. Must report to jail immediately. Court grants 14 days credit towards the 90 day conditional jail sentence.
